revised_title: Investigating Strains in Abraded Diamond Surfaces
tldr: The authors studied the strains in abraded diamond surfaces using a microabrasion technique and -ray topographic analysis. They found that the strain field in and around the abrasion patches could be explained by a fracture mechanism, with surface cracking and residual compression in the diamond. This supports the idea that abrasion of diamond surfaces is primarily due to fracture processes.
